content: Honestly. All of these are headlines from the Family Research Council and NRA websites in the last month. What is it with the Conservative mind's need to manufacture persecution where none exists? According to them Christians are under attack!! We Can't Knuckle Under to Muslims While Giving Lip Service to Religious Freedom[/URL] --hmm. I thought I read somewhere that somn like 95% of the country professes to be Christian. do they really think letting a couple of folks build their own mosque is a threat to the nation? Judicial "activists" are manufacturing law out of whole cloth, on a lark!! After years of holding people in prison without charge, a judge moves to get something going on these cases and the conservatives are wailing and pulling their hair out by the roots! Obama, personally, is coming to get your guns!! Stock up on Ammo! [no hot links, NO HOT LINKS GOT IT NOW? I've lived in some pretty seedy neighborhoods in my time and I've never owned a gun or even known anyone who owned a gun. Where do these people live that they're always dodging bullets? What is going on with these people? Are they for real? According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )? This message has been edited. Last edited by: <NEMESIS1960>, Fri 08 May 2009 09:13 AM

content: In all seriousness, the opening post is just a tweak at all my conservative friends (Democrats AND Republicans, Dave). I guess what I'm really getting at are all these anecdotal stories of liberal oppression. It seems to me that conservatives live in fear of a host of bogeymen that are all out to get them- gays, Hillary, Obama, etc. All I'm saying is: what's up with that?

content: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: In all seriousness, the opening post is just a tweak at all my conservative friends (Democrats AND Republicans, Dave). I guess what I'm really getting at are all these anecdotal stories of liberal oppression. It seems to me that conservatives live in fear of a host of bogeymen that are all out to get them- gays, Hillary, Obama, etc. All I'm saying is: what's up with that? In the 2004 Presidential race, when it looked like Howard Dean would be the Democrats choice, the NRA announced that if such was the case they would not take a position in the election. While Dean was not the leftist radical that some Conservatives called him, he certainly was a Liberal. With a few exceptions, right wing as they are, the NRA is quite fair in endorsing candidates - They are after all a one issue organisation - To protect the Second Amendment. Who then should they endorse? Mayor "I'll shoot you with my gun if you're against gun control" Bloomberg? Dave

title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: C'mon, get off the partisan savior soapbox. Both sides have mouthpieces that claim to speak for a sect of society. For every report of rightist panic, I can report one of leftist extremism. This is nothing more than partisan pundits doing what they do best. The problem is that conservatism these days... isn't. Fiscal responsibility? Smaller government? Private sector, capitalist ventures? Religious rights and freedoms without government interference? In another thread, member Stillkit made some excellent observations concerning the true demise of conservative values in America; and while I do not recall the thread in which his comments exist, I wholeheartedly agree with him. He contends that the vast majority of Americans would vote for a true conservative if one was to be found - problem is, none really exist. Or, more aptly, we're not in the spotlight. But we do exist, and we're not at all like you label "conservatives" to be. The problem is partisan politics, not the fundamental values of either Conservatism or Liberalism. Both of those parties represent the majority of the wants of the people. But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

He contends that the vast majority of Americans would vote for a true conservative if one was to be found - problem is, none really exist. Or, more aptly, we're not in the spotlight. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

content: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )? I agree with above observations. Nobody is forcing gay marriage on heterosexuals. Nobody is forcing all pregnant women to abort their babies. Nobody is banging on doors demanding that citizens' firearms be confiscated. But IMO these issues are cash cows for conservative PACs. Spool up the masses! Create bogus straw man debates! Use one unidentified person's conjecture and blow it up as FACT to motivate the lemmings! And all for one purpose: to make money for their "causes" ... Think the "liberals" are different? Nope! Same issues, opposite viewpoint, and the money piles in. Money makes the (political) world go 'round.

content: You have to wonder why the Republicans are so afraid to dump Limbaugh? Steel is a legitimate Conservative, why did he suck up to Limbaugh in such a disgraceful manner? Here's a typical Limbaugh parody of reality, taken right off todays home page. And I've seen the below quote parroted on this forum. Why do Conservatives let this continue to happen and continue to happen? quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan. Conservatives have allowed Limbaugh to become a spokesperson. They refuse to challenge him. Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave
quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan.

Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave

title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: In all seriousness, the opening post is just a tweak at all my conservative friends (Democrats AND Republicans, Dave). I guess what I'm really getting at are all these anecdotal stories of liberal oppression. It seems to me that conservatives live in fear of a host of bogeymen that are all out to get them- gays, Hillary, Obama, etc. All I'm saying is: what's up with that? In the 2004 Presidential race, when it looked like Howard Dean would be the Democrats choice, the NRA announced that if such was the case they would not take a position in the election. While Dean was not the leftist radical that some Conservatives called him, he certainly was a Liberal. With a few exceptions, right wing as they are, the NRA is quite fair in endorsing candidates - They are after all a one issue organisation - To protect the Second Amendment. Who then should they endorse? Mayor "I'll shoot you with my gun if you're against gun control" Bloomberg? Dave
quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: In all seriousness, the opening post is just a tweak at all my conservative friends (Democrats AND Republicans, Dave). title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: C'mon, get off the partisan savior soapbox. Both sides have mouthpieces that claim to speak for a sect of society. For every report of rightist panic, I can report one of leftist extremism. This is nothing more than partisan pundits doing what they do best. The problem is that conservatism these days... isn't. Fiscal responsibility? Smaller government? Private sector, capitalist ventures? Religious rights and freedoms without government interference? In another thread, member Stillkit made some excellent observations concerning the true demise of conservative values in America; and while I do not recall the thread in which his comments exist, I wholeheartedly agree with him. He contends that the vast majority of Americans would vote for a true conservative if one was to be found - problem is, none really exist. Or, more aptly, we're not in the spotlight. But we do exist, and we're not at all like you label "conservatives" to be. The problem is partisan politics, not the fundamental values of either Conservatism or Liberalism. Both of those parties represent the majority of the wants of the people. But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )? I agree with above observations. Nobody is forcing gay marriage on heterosexuals. Nobody is forcing all pregnant women to abort their babies. Nobody is banging on doors demanding that citizens' firearms be confiscated. But IMO these issues are cash cows for conservative PACs. Spool up the masses! Create bogus straw man debates! Use one unidentified person's conjecture and blow it up as FACT to motivate the lemmings! And all for one purpose: to make money for their "causes" ... Think the "liberals" are different? Nope! Same issues, opposite viewpoint, and the money piles in. Money makes the (political) world go 'round.
quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )?
reply: I agree with above observations. Nobody is forcing gay marriage on heterosexuals. Nobody is forcing all pregnant women to abort their babies. Nobody is banging on doors demanding that citizens' firearms be confiscated. But IMO these issues are cash cows for conservative PACs. Spool up the masses! Create bogus straw man debates! Use one unidentified person's conjecture and blow it up as FACT to motivate the lemmings! And all for one purpose: to make money for their "causes" ... Think the "liberals" are different? Nope! Same issues, opposite viewpoint, and the money piles in. Money makes the (political) world go 'round.

But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. Thats because everything is presented as an either/or issue. its fun being a pro second amendment, pro choice, small government, pro military, pro union, guy how woks for law enforcment who would rather pull a tooth than call a cop, guy like me. everyone always calls you what you're not. 4 years ago I was called a dirty republican for say Bush wasn't going to be Hitler part II. now I'm a filthy lib for saying Obama isn't going to be Hitler part II.

content: You have to wonder why the Republicans are so afraid to dump Limbaugh? Steel is a legitimate Conservative, why did he suck up to Limbaugh in such a disgraceful manner? Here's a typical Limbaugh parody of reality, taken right off todays home page. And I've seen the below quote parroted on this forum. Why do Conservatives let this continue to happen and continue to happen? quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan. Conservatives have allowed Limbaugh to become a spokesperson. They refuse to challenge him. Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave
quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan.
reply: You have to wonder why the Republicans are so afraid to dump Limbaugh? Steel is a legitimate Conservative, why did he suck up to Limbaugh in such a disgraceful manner? Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave

content: Honestly. All of these are headlines from the Family Research Council and NRA websites in the last month. What is it with the Conservative mind's need to manufacture persecution where none exists? According to them Christians are under attack!! We Can't Knuckle Under to Muslims While Giving Lip Service to Religious Freedom[/URL] --hmm. I thought I read somewhere that somn like 95% of the country professes to be Christian. do they really think letting a couple of folks build their own mosque is a threat to the nation? Judicial "activists" are manufacturing law out of whole cloth, on a lark!! After years of holding people in prison without charge, a judge moves to get something going on these cases and the conservatives are wailing and pulling their hair out by the roots! Obama, personally, is coming to get your guns!! Stock up on Ammo! [no hot links, NO HOT LINKS GOT IT NOW? I've lived in some pretty seedy neighborhoods in my time and I've never owned a gun or even known anyone who owned a gun. Where do these people live that they're always dodging bullets? What is going on with these people? Are they for real? According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )? This message has been edited. Last edited by: <NEMESIS1960>, Fri 08 May 2009 09:13 AM

Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )? I agree with above observations. Nobody is forcing gay marriage on heterosexuals. Nobody is forcing all pregnant women to abort their babies. Nobody is banging on doors demanding that citizens' firearms be confiscated. But IMO these issues are cash cows for conservative PACs. Spool up the masses! Create bogus straw man debates! Use one unidentified person's conjecture and blow it up as FACT to motivate the lemmings! And all for one purpose: to make money for their "causes" ... Think the "liberals" are different? Nope! Same issues, opposite viewpoint, and the money piles in. Money makes the (political) world go 'round.
quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: According to them, if the Liberals win then they'll force you to get gay married, abortions will be compulsory, and all Christians will be fed to the lions (again!! ). Honestly, what color is the sky on their planet ( and why is it always falling?? )?
reply: I agree with above observations. Nobody is forcing gay marriage on heterosexuals. Nobody is forcing all pregnant women to abort their babies. Nobody is banging on doors demanding that citizens' firearms be confiscated. But IMO these issues are cash cows for conservative PACs. Spool up the masses! Create bogus straw man debates! Use one unidentified person's conjecture and blow it up as FACT to motivate the lemmings! And all for one purpose: to make money for their "causes" ... Think the "liberals" are different? Nope! Same issues, opposite viewpoint, and the money piles in. Money makes the (political) world go 'round.
title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: quote: The problem is partisan politics, not the fundamental values of either Conservatism or Liberalism. Both of those parties represent the majority of the wants of the people. But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. Thats because everything is presented as an either/or issue. its fun being a pro second amendment, pro choice, small government, pro military, pro union, guy how woks for law enforcment who would rather pull a tooth than call a cop, guy like me. everyone always calls you what you're not. 4 years ago I was called a dirty republican for say Bush wasn't going to be Hitler part II. now I'm a filthy lib for saying Obama isn't going to be Hitler part II.
quote: The problem is partisan politics, not the fundamental values of either Conservatism or Liberalism. Both of those parties represent the majority of the wants of the people. But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington.
reply: Thats because everything is presented as an either/or issue. its fun being a pro second amendment, pro choice, small government, pro military, pro union, guy how woks for law enforcment who would rather pull a tooth than call a cop, guy like me. everyone always calls you what you're not. 4 years ago I was called a dirty republican for say Bush wasn't going to be Hitler part II. now I'm a filthy lib for saying Obama isn't going to be Hitler part II.
title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: The left is suffering from short term memory loss. It wasn't that long ago when a certain First Lady was bemoaning "The Vast Right Wing Conspiracy". Amongst other folks on the left snivelling similar sentiments.
reply: The left is suffering from short term memory loss. It wasn't that long ago when a certain First Lady was bemoaning "The Vast Right Wing Conspiracy". Amongst other folks on the left snivelling similar sentiments.
title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: quote: Originally posted by FollowMeInfantry: C'mon, get off the partisan savior soapbox. Both sides have mouthpieces that claim to speak for a sect of society. For every report of rightist panic, I can report one of leftist extremism. This is nothing more than partisan pundits doing what they do best. The problem is that conservatism these days... isn't. Fiscal responsibility? Smaller government? Private sector, capitalist ventures? Religious rights and freedoms without government interference? In another thread, member Stillkit made some excellent observations concerning the true demise of conservative values in America; and while I do not recall the thread in which his comments exist, I wholeheartedly agree with him. He contends that the vast majority of Americans would vote for a true conservative if one was to be found - problem is, none really exist. Or, more aptly, we're not in the spotlight. But we do exist, and we're not at all like you label "conservatives" to be. The problem is partisan politics, not the fundamental values of either Conservatism or Liberalism. Both of those parties represent the majority of the wants of the people. But both have caved to extremism, and now they both represent the minority of the people. The extreme right and the extreme left. The vast majority of us, undoubtedly moderates, have little to no representation in Washington. Which is why I "usually" try to refer to the Repub leadership, the media talking heads and the Christian right as "so called conservatives".

reply: Which is why I "usually" try to refer to the Repub leadership, the media talking heads and the Christian right as "so called conservatives".
title: Conservative's Persecution Complex

content: You have to wonder why the Republicans are so afraid to dump Limbaugh? Steel is a legitimate Conservative, why did he suck up to Limbaugh in such a disgraceful manner? Here's a typical Limbaugh parody of reality, taken right off todays home page. And I've seen the below quote parroted on this forum. Why do Conservatives let this continue to happen and continue to happen? quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan. Conservatives have allowed Limbaugh to become a spokesperson. They refuse to challenge him. Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave
quote: RUSH: A couple of audio sound bites here, then we'll go back to the phones. First off, this afternoon, CNN Live. The guest, American University Chair of Islamic Studies Akbar Ahmed, and he said this about Barack Obama's challenges. AHMED: Remember that today for President Obama his greatest headache is not coming from Rush Limbaugh and the Republicans. It's really coming from Afghanistan and Pakistan. He staked his reputation and his foreign policy in that part of the world. RUSH: So here you have the American University Chair of Islamic Studies, Akbar Ahmed, saying, "Limbaugh and the Republicans are not Obama's greatest headache. It's Afghanistan and Pakistan." Pakistan's falling apart. Pakistan's falling apart, and the Taliban is taking over. They did a stupid thing. They advocated a stupid thing. They gave the Taliban a province, at the urging of the Obama administration. They gave the Taliban a province in Pakistan. "Okay, you guys. You want to be the Taliban? Be the Taliban in this province," and guess what? The Taliban's taken over neighborhoods provinces, or trying to. Once again, even in Pakistan, they're exhibiting a total lack of understanding of the enemy -- of evil -- and what their intent is. And they have every intention of getting back in control in Afghanistan.
reply: You have to wonder why the Republicans are so afraid to dump Limbaugh? Steel is a legitimate Conservative, why did he suck up to Limbaugh in such a disgraceful manner? Here's a typical Limbaugh parody of reality, taken right off todays home page. And I've seen the below quote parroted on this forum. Why do Conservatives let this continue to happen and continue to happen?  Conservatives have allowed Limbaugh to become a spokesperson. They refuse to challenge him. Simply refuse to once and for all label him as the opportunist extreme nut job that he is. Do they really think they benefit from being associated with him? Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Frank_A_Valdez: In all seriousness, the opening post is just a tweak at all my conservative friends (Democrats AND Republicans, Dave). I guess what I'm really getting at are all these anecdotal stories of liberal oppression. It seems to me that conservatives live in fear of a host of bogeymen that are all out to get them- gays, Hillary, Obama, etc. All I'm saying is: what's up with that? na what were afraid of are dim-witted libterds swinging from the vine
